title: How To Train Your Dog To Walk On A Leash
summary: A leash is long enough to give you enough room to walk comfortably but short enough so that it doesn’t drag on the ground when you’re not holding it. A crate can be a great place for your dog to rest, especially when you're training them to walk on a leash. The best way to train your dog is to use a “heel” command to keep them closer to you and prevent them from becoming a nuisance around other people and dogs.

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"What You\u2019ll Need"),mdx("p",null,"Before you begin training your dog, you\u2019ll need to stock up on a few essentials. You may already have a few of the below listed items, but it\u2019s a good idea to check that everything is in good condition and ready to be used."),mdx("ul",null,mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Leash - Get a leash that is long enough to give you enough room to walk comfortably but short enough so that it doesn\u2019t drag on the ground when you\u2019re not holding it."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Crate - A crate can be a great place for your dog to rest, especially when you\u2019re training them to walk on a leash."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Treats - While any snacks will do, certain treats are actually designed to help with dog training."),mdx("li",{parentName:"ul"},"Clicker - This device is designed to mark a desired behaviour, like your dog sitting or staying put.")),mdx("h2",null,"Start Outside"),mdx("p",null,"Before you ever bring your dog indoors to walk with you on a leash, you should start your training outside. There are a few reasons for this, but it\u2019s best to start off with a foundation of positive associations before moving to more stressful environments. A sidewalk or patch of grass will work fine for this stage of training."),mdx("p",null,"First, you want to get your dog accustomed to the feel of the leash. You can let your dog sniff and get used to the leash while they are still attached to you. If they seem frustrated or upset by the leash, you should try a different type of collar. If you start out with a negative association with the leash, your dog is much more likely to be fearful and hesitant whenever they are outside with the leash on."),mdx("h2",null,"Teach \u201CCome\u201D Command"),mdx("p",null,"For an indoor training session, start off by teaching your dog the \u201Ccome\u201D command. This is a useful command to have in case your dog ever gets loose or starts to get aggressive around other dogs or people. You\u2019ll want to keep your training indoors until your dog is completely comfortable outside with the leash on."),mdx("p",null,"To start, begin by holding a treat in your hand, palm facing your dog. Let them sniff the treat and, if they try to take the treat, say the word \u201Ccome.\u201D This is the noise you want your dog to associate with the treat, so keep saying it each time you give them a treat. They may not catch on right away, but they will catch on eventually. "),mdx("h2",null,"Before You Walk Together"),mdx("p",null,"Before you ever head outside with your dog and the leash attached, it\u2019s important to let them get used to wearing the collar. Again, if they seem frustrated or scared, try a different collar before moving on to the next step of the training. Putting the collar on them and letting them walk around the house with it on for about five minutes a day for a week will help ease them into the feeling of wearing it."),mdx("p",null,"The best way to do this is to put the collar on them, let them walk around the house for a few minutes, and then take it off. Don\u2019t ever leave the collar on them while they are sleeping or unattended."),mdx("h2",null,"Train \u201CHeel\u201D Command"),mdx("p",null,"The best way to train your dog to walk by your side is to use a \u201Cheel\u201D command. This is a very useful tip when walking your dog around other people and dogs since it will keep them closer to you and prevent them from becoming a nuisance. You\u2019ll want to start off with your dog wearing the collar and the leash on."),mdx("p",null,"For this part of the training, you can either walk around your yard or walk in a wide open area where there is little to no human or dog traffic. When you start walking, start with a slow pace and keep a consistent rhythm. As your dog begins to walk with you, say the word \u201Cheel\u201D and gently tug on the leash to encourage them to walk beside you."),mdx("h2",null,"Important Note"),mdx("p",null,"When training your dog to walk on a leash, be certain to keep things positive and consistent. Avoid sudden jerking on their collar or using punishing tones. If you remain consistent, you will see results in no time. Dogs can be a great walking companion, but only if you take the time to properly train them."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

How to Stay Organized and Sane as a Busy Mom
The Ultimate Guide to Spring Cleaning Your Home

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Home cleaning in spring is the best time to thoroughly clean your home. As the weather gets warmer, so does our house. Dirt and grime that has accumulated over the long winter months begins to dissipate as we put away all of our heavy coats, hats, and gloves. With fewer layers to trap it, dust, germs, and other nasty particles are exposed for what they really are: gross!
We all know that a tidy home is a happy one. Keeping a tidy household at all times can be challenging. The pressures of work and other responsibilities often get in the way of keeping things clean and organized. But with some preparation and planning you can make spring home cleaning your primary focus instead of an afterthought. Here\u2019s how\u2026`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Train Your Dog to Allow You to Groom Them

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Dogs are often seen as low-maintenance pets. While this is true in a lot of cases, it\u2019t necessarily the case all the time. Depending on your dog\u2019s breed and their natural instincts, you might find that grooming them can prove to be a very tricky task. If you have struggled to get your dog used to being groomed for some time now, there are several tips and tricks you can use to help train them to allow you to do so.
Dog grooming is something that many pet owners struggle with from time to time, especially if your pet has a specific type of fur that doesn\u2019t grow too much like long hair or curly hair. It\u2019s natural for dogs to dislike having their hair caught in things like bushes or trees while they hunt or run around outside; however, it can also be difficult when trying to keep their hair short and tidy at home.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get through a Break-Up

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Everyone knows break-ups are tough. Even if you know the relationship is ending, the final moments can still be filled with pain and heartbreak. However, a breakup doesn\u2019t need to be final in every sense of the word. In time, you will recover from your failed relationship and move on with your life. Here are some effective ways to make this happen sooner rather than later.
If you\u2019ve recently broken up with your partner or dating partner, it can feel like the end of the world. But it\u2019s not! A relationship coming to an end does not mean there is something wrong with you or that you aren\u2019t good enough for anyone or that you will never find love again. Your heart is broken at this moment because you cared deeply about this person - now you just have to understand why and how things went south so that it doesn\u2019t happen again in your future relationships`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Deal with Trust Issues in Relationships

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`When you first start dating someone, trust probably isn\u2019t the biggest issue on your mind. You\u2019re getting to know this person and trying to figure out if there might be a potential future with them or not. However, once you get into a relationship with this person and things get more serious, trust can very quickly become an issue.
Even if you don\u2019t trust someone right away, that doesn\u2019t mean the trust issues don\u2019t come up later on. It may take time for them to make you feel uneasy or distrustful of your partner. But it also could be something that crops up almost immediately \u2013 especially if you meet them in a place like a nightclub, bar or other place where people tend to hookup without much thought as to who they\u2019re hooking up with! This article will offer some tips on how to deal with these trust issues in relationships and help resolve any problems from arising in the first place.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: 5 Ways to Reduce Stress during the Holiday Season
How to Make Time for Your Hobbies

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"When you love something, it feels like there\u2019s not enough time in the day to do everything you want to do. But at the same time, when you don\u2019t have anything that fills your days with joy and meaning, it feels like there are not enough hours in a week. Many people struggle with finding time for their hobbies. They either feel too busy or believe that they simply don\u2019t have the opportunities to pursue something they enjoy. This feeling is understandable\u2014because most people lead incredibly busy lives. Work, school, family, friends, and other obligations take up a lot of time and energy. So how can you carve out some time for your hobbies? It might seem impossible right now\u2014but trust us, it\u2019s possible! Even if your schedule feels full beyond measure right now, there are always little cracks of space that can grow and expand into larger windows of opportunity."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Get Out of a Style Rut

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The risk of falling into a style rut is something we all have to deal with from time to time. It happens to even the most confident and daring of people, so you\u2019re certainly not alone if you feel like your style is stagnating and you can\u2019t think of anything new or exciting to wear. Whether it\u2019s because you haven\u2019t found a new piece of clothing that excites you in months, or because you just don\u2019t know what to wear after wearing variations on the same theme for several weeks in a row, everyone gets stuck in a rut now and again. Thankfully there are ways to get out of it and discover a new lease on your personal style once again."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
